definition: to hold/to grip/to grasp
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to compile/bun (of hair)/red silk ribbon/variant of 纘|缵[zuan3]
variant of 纂[zuan3]/to compile
to grasp/to clutch
to clench one's fists

sentences.english: His longest nail is 35cm (14ins) long and prevents him from making his hand into a fist.
sentences.chinese: 现在他最长的指甲已有35厘米，这使他无法攥拳头。

sentences.english: He clung to the rope with both hands.
His hands continued to clench and unclench.
sentences.chinese: 他的双手反复地攥紧又松开。

sentences.english: "Mr. Silver, sir?" I asked, holding out the note.
sentences.chinese: “阁下是西尔弗先生吗？”我问，手里攥着纸条。

sentences.english: His fists clenched as he faced the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 当他面对敌人时，他的两个拳头紧紧攥着。

sentences.english: Is Chang-an red the eye socket point nod, Zuan in the hand of tightly.
sentences.chinese: 长安红着眼眶点点头，手里攥的紧紧地。

sentences.english: High class Tibetan spear with gold inlaid .
His heart thumped audibly as his benumbed hand held the receiver in a desperate grip.
sentences.chinese: 他的心怦怦跳着，痉挛的手死死地攥住电话听筒。

sentences.english: ” “An interviewee took his bubble gum out of his mouth and held it in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 一个应试者把泡泡糖从嘴里拿出来攥在手里。

sentences.english: Mrs… Davidson gave a little gasp , and she clenched her hands more tightly.
sentences.chinese: 戴维逊太太微微地喘了一口气，把双手攥得更紧了。

sentences.english: He squeezed the steering wheel until his knuckles turned ash- gray.
sentences.chinese: 他的手狠狠地攥着方向盘，指节都变成了灰白色。

sentences.english: Here, I live in tight grip of his hand, let him say anything.
sentences.chinese: 说到这里，我紧紧地攥住他的手，不让他再说下去。

sentences.english: He unlocked his grip on my arm.
sentences.chinese: 他把紧攥着我的胳臂的手松开。

sentences.english: What makes a person tighter than a bathing cap?
sentences.chinese: 是什么使一个人把钱攥得比游泳帽还紧？

sentences.english: Lily flung out her hand, groped for her friend's and held it fast.
sentences.chinese: 丽莉猛地伸出手，摸到她朋友的手，紧紧地攥住。

sentences.english: When she had gone I began to walk up and down the room, clenching my fists.
sentences.chinese: 她走后，我在屋里踱来踱去，紧攥着拳头。
